races.nyt_race_description: Senator Kelly Loeffler, who was appointed to her seat in 2019 and is seeking to finish a term that ends in 2022, is vying against the Rev. Raphael Warnock, who leads Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta. In Novemberâ€™s crowded special election, Mr. Warnock finished with 32.9 percent of the vote and Ms. Loeffler had 25.9 percent.
races.poll_display: Polls closed at 7 p.m. Eastern time.

top_level.sentence: Raphael Warnock, Democrat, wins the Senate special runoff election in Georgia.
top_level.generatedText: Raphael Warnock, Democrat, wins the Senate special runoff election in Georgia.

winner_card_leadin.sentence: Race called by The Associated Press.
winner_card_leadin.generatedText: Race called by The Associated Press.

eevp.sentence: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.
eevp.generatedText: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.

live_update.author: Nate Cohn
live_update.text: The race seems close but Democrats are actually overwhelming favorites to prevail, including Jon Ossoff. The remaining vote is from heavily Democratic counties. Update: Warnock has been declared the winner by The Associated Press. And on Wednesday afternoon, multiple networks projected Ossoff as the winner.

races.nyt_race_description: David Perdue, a Republican whose Senate term ended on Sunday, has faced a competitive challenge from Jon Ossoff, a documentary film executive. In November, Mr. Perdue fell just short of the majority he would have needed to avoid a runoff, winning 49.7 percent of the vote, while Mr. Ossoff had 47.9 percent â€” a difference of about 88,000 votes.
races.poll_display: Polls closed at 7 p.m. Eastern time.

top_level.sentence: Jon Ossoff, Democrat, wins the Senate runoff election in Georgia.
top_level.generatedText: Jon Ossoff, Democrat, wins the Senate runoff election in Georgia.

winner_card_leadin.sentence: Race called by The Associated Press.
winner_card_leadin.generatedText: Race called by The Associated Press.

eevp.sentence: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.
eevp.generatedText: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.

live_update.author: Nate Cohn
live_update.text: The race seems close but Democrats are actually overwhelming favorites to prevail, including Jon Ossoff. The remaining vote is from heavily Democratic counties. Update: Warnock has been declared the winner by The Associated Press. And on Wednesday afternoon, multiple networks projected Ossoff as the winner.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Hereâ€™s why Warnock and Ossoff won: Far more people of both parties voted than usual in a runoff, but the Democratic turnout was stronger, largely because of Black voters.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos
liveUpdates.text: Congress confirmed Joe Bidenâ€™s presidential victory, defying a mob that stormed the Capitol in a display of violence egged on by President Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: Trump was telling people today that he was happy Loeffler and Perdue lost, according to a person familiar with the conversations. He said they didnâ€™t defend him enough.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Today encapsulated the politics of progress and grievance that have defined the Trump years: Senate wins for Warnock and Ossoff, and a mob at the Capitol.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Both Democrats now lead their defeated Republican opponents by margins that are larger than the threshold required to trigger a recount under Georgia law.
Democrats have won the Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Jonathan Martin
liveUpdates.text: Democrats have now captured control of the Senate as Jon Ossoff has defeated David Perdue, following the Rev. Raphael Warnockâ€™s victory over Senator Kelly Loeffler.
Jon Ossoff, Democrat, wins the Senate runoff election in Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: A small new batch of votes has been reported in Georgia. Jon Ossoffâ€™s lead over David Perdue increases by 56 votes to 18,479.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Jon Ossoffâ€™s margin over David Perdue is now 3,626 votes below the 0.5 percentage point threshold needed to avoid a recount.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Amid the chaos at the U.S. Capitol, more Georgia votes have just been released. Jon Ossoffâ€™s lead has increased to 18,423 votes, or 0.42 percentage points.

liveUpdates.author: Jonathan Martin
liveUpdates.text: Even before polls closed in Georgia, Republicans were grumbling that a â€œcheck-and-balanceâ€ message had tested well in polling â€” but it required the G.O.P. candidates to say Trump lost.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: About 14,000 overseas and military ballots have not been returned. Far fewer than 14,000 will be counted, since many will not be sent at all or received by a Friday deadline.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The biggest batch of uncounted ballots is in DeKalb County, where Ossoff has won 83% of the vote counted so far. If he maintains that pace heâ€™ll pad his margin by 11,922 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Once one or two large counties complete their count, Ossoff is likely to exceed the margin needed to avoid a recount. That usually leads news organizations to declare a winner.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Officials involved in the Georgia campaigns believe the counties will begin reporting the results from their outstanding ballots in the early afternoon.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Ossoffâ€™s lead has grown to 17,567 votes, or 0.4 percentage points â€” just shy of the 0.5-point margin that would help him avoid a recount.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Speaking to a gathering of die-hard fans near the White House, Trump seemed to concede that the G.O.P. Senate candidates had lost, telling the crowd that â€œthey never had a shot.â€

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: A big question: How many moderate Republicans did Loeffler and Perdue alienate for every base Trump voter they fired up by supporting Trumpâ€™s attempt to overturn his loss?

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: Itâ€™s worth remembering that Warnock will have to run for re-election in two years. Whoever wins the Ossoff-Perdue race will serve a full term of six years.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: â€œBuckle up!â€ writes Chuck Schumer, who is in line to become the Senateâ€™s majority leader if Ossoff prevails. In a statement, Schumer is already declaring a Democratic majority.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Mazzei
liveUpdates.text: Warnock told NPR this morning that his Senate victory was the result of a decade of work registering hundreds of thousands of Georgians to vote: â€œWelcome to the new Georgia.â€

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: If he wins, Jon Ossoff would be the youngest Democratic senator elected since â€¦ Joe Biden.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Trump is falsely claiming that officials â€œjust happened to find 50,000 ballotsâ€ in Georgia. Gabriel Sterling, a Republican election official in the state, says the claim is untrue.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling says he anticipates that all but a few votes will be counted by 1 p.m. today and that Jon Ossoff will very likely defeat David Perdue.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling listed about 10 counties where absentee votes submitted yesterday have not been counted. The bulk are from Democratic-leaning counties in the Atlanta metro area.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: At a news conference, Gabriel Sterling, a top official from the Georgia secretary of stateâ€™s office, refers to Jon Ossoff as â€œSenator to be, probably, Ossoff.â€

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: With more than 60,000 absentee votes uncounted, mostly from Democratic-leaning counties, a Georgia elections official says Ossoff is the likely winner and no recount will likely be necessary.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: â€œIt turns out that telling the voters that the election is rigged is not a great way to turn out your voters,â€ Mitt Romney said this morning.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Biden said in a statement that he believed Democrats would take control of the Senate and looked forward to working with â€œa Majority Leader Schumer.â€

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Georgia in the Trump era: Gov. Kemp narrowly beats Stacey Abrams in 2018 with Trumpâ€™s help. Now, heâ€™s booed at Trump rallies; sheâ€™s celebrated by her party for flipping the state.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Thereâ€™s no doubt about it anymore: Georgia is a battleground. There are forces at work that are rapidly turning the state blue, redrawing the American electoral map.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling, a top Georgia elections official, said that a majority of ballots still to be counted are expected to come from traditionally Democratic areas of the state.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The estimated remaining votes are mostly mail ballots; Ossoff has been comfortably outpacing Perdue on these.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling, a top Georgia elections official, said on CNN that Ossoff would likely end up keeping his lead but it was unclear whether it would be narrow enough for a recount.

liveUpdates.author: Jenny Gross
liveUpdates.text: Ossoff posted a video this morning declaring victory and thanking Georgia voters. He leads by 0.4 percentage points, within the range that could trigger a recount.

liveUpdates.author: Jenny Gross
liveUpdates.text: With control of the Senate hanging in the balance, Ossoff widened his lead over Perdue overnight, to 16,370 votes, though the contest remains too close to call.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Georgiaâ€™s Senate races were the two most expensive congressional races ever, with a combined cost of more than $800 million, according to the Center for Responsive Politics.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: If the vote tallies continue on the current trajectory to an Ossoff victory, the 33-year-old would become the youngest senator elected in 40 years.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: In the past year Atlanta has lostÂ the civil rights giants John Lewis, Joseph Lowery and C.T. Vivian. Warnock, who preaches at Martin Luther King Jr.â€™s church, has positioned himself as a bearer of their torch.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Warnock has called on Congress to restore the Voting Rights Act. He served as chairman of the New Georgia Project, a voting rights group established by Stacey Abrams.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In his stump speech, Warnock emphasized his childhood in a Savannah housing project and how his father got him up early every morning and told him to â€œput your shoes on.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: One of the most interesting things to watch Wednesday in Washington: Will Mitch McConnell continue to show deference to Trump? Will he blame him if the G.O.P. loses its Senate majority?

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Ossoffâ€™s lead continues to grow. Heâ€™s now up by 12,806 votes. Thatâ€™s larger than Bidenâ€™s victory in the state in November.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Perdue campaign says in a new statement that they believe they won and will â€œexhaust every recourse to ensure all legally cast ballots are properly countedâ€ â€” echoing Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: The state of Georgia has not had a Democratic U.S. senator since early 2005, when Zell Miller, who endorsed George W. Bush in 2004, retired.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: How long before we get to the Republican infighting on whether Trumpâ€™s false claim of a stolen election suppressed G.O.P. turnout?

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Mitch McConnell is going to have a heck of a day on Wednesday.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Ossoffâ€™s new lead has grown to 9,527 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: If Ossoff also wins, will Dems try to recruit Republican senators to switch sides and join a new majority party? Thereâ€™s precedent and it is now the Trump Republican Party, so some might be tempted.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Raphael Warnockâ€™s win comes after Republicans relentlessly attacked him as a radical and Marxist. But his win could ultimately give more power to Democratic moderates in a divided Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Warnock has just broken a particularly important barrier given the history of the Jim Crow South.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: When Raphael Warnock was born, his senators were the segregationists Herman Talmadge and Richard Russell. He will now be the first Black Senator from Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Jonathan Martin
liveUpdates.text: Democrats have moved a major step closer to capturing control of the Senate as the Rev. Raphael Warnock has won his hard-fought runoff election in Georgia.
Raphael Warnock, Democrat, wins the Senate special runoff election in Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: With more votes coming in, Jon Ossoff has now taken a slight lead over David Perdue, with 97 percent of the estimated votes counted.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: The Ossoff campaign said â€œwe fully expectâ€ to win the election, adding: â€œThe outstanding vote is squarely in parts of the state where Jonâ€™s performance has been dominant.â€

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Loeffler refused to concede tonight, telling supporters: â€œWeâ€™re going to win this election.â€ But Warnock is ahead with most of the remaining vote in Democratic areas.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: An interesting Warnock factoid: One of his early forays into political advocacy was in New York back in 1997, when he protested then-Mayor Giulianiâ€™s workfare program.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: Hard to overstate how giddy some Biden allies sound tonight. Even Bidenâ€™s own victory in November was tempered by disappointment that Dems, they assumed, had probably lost the Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Warnock invokes M.L.K.â€™s â€œbeloved communityâ€ in a speech that sounds very much like a preacherâ€™s sermon. â€œWe have a choice to make,â€ he said. â€œWill we continue to play political games as people suffer?â€

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: â€œI am going to the Senate to work for all of Georgia, no matter who you cast your vote for in this election,â€ Warnock says.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Speaking on a livestream in front of a sign that read â€œThank you, Georgia,â€ the Rev. Raphael Warnock, whoâ€™s leading Kelly Loeffler, stopped just short of declaring outright victory.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: A dual loss for Republicans in Georgia would deliver a verdict not only on Trumpâ€™s post-election political power but also on the politics of his false voter fraud narrative.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Tonightâ€™s close races and Trumpâ€™s doomed attempt to block the Electoral College ratification in Congress seem likely to make him a weakened figure â€” even within the G.O.P.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Other questions: what would a 50-50 split in the Senate mean for policy in a Biden-Harris administration? Could it mean $2,000 pandemic checks in the near future?

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Two big questions: Will either race be called tonight? And will they fall within 0.5 percentage points, Georgiaâ€™s recount window? (If Ossoff wins, he might find himself in that window.)

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Turnout was more than 4.3 million. That includes more than two million early votes, more than 1.2 million election day votes and more than 995,000 absentee-by-mail votes, with more early and absentee votes to be added to the total.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: A win for Warnock would represent a win for the religious left, a group that has tried mightily to assert itself as the religious right has consolidated power in the Trump era.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: With Georgiaâ€™s tight Senate races yet uncalled, state elections officials believe that the remaining outstanding votes come mostly from Democratic-leaning counties.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: The Rev. Raphael Warnock has told church members that if he wins, he intends to keep his position preaching at Ebenezer Baptist in Atlanta, one of the worldâ€™s most famous pulpits.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Nearing midnight, about 15 Georgia counties have yet to report all their votes, including four Atlanta metro area counties â€” Cobb, DeKalb, Fulton, and Gwinnett.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: In A.P. voter surveys, 56 percent of Georgia voters said they disapproved of Trumpâ€™s handling of the results of the presidential election.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Ossoff and Warnock both have a greater than 95 percent chance to win, according to our estimates. The remaining vote is overwhelmingly Democratic.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Gov. Brian Kemp appointed Kelly Loeffler to the Senate in 2019, surmising that she would appeal to moderates. But she moved to the right, becoming a major Trump supporter.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Fewer than 500 votes now separate Perdue and Ossoff. Feels like a horse race rounding into the home stretch.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Georgia election officials have suggested we may not know final numbers until midday tomorrow, right around the time when Congress is scheduled to certify the presidential election. (Maybe get some rest?)

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: Loeffler and Perdue stood side by side a lot, but to Georgians theyâ€™re quite different. To begin with, heâ€™s from there; sheâ€™s not.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Though Ossoff trails Perdue by about 10,000 votes, the couple of counties with outstanding votes, DeKalb and Cobb, are Dem strongholds. Ossoff is ahead of his November margins in both.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: â€œIf they win, Iâ€™ll get no credit,â€ Trump predicted of Republicans last night. â€œIf they lose, theyâ€™re gonna blame Trump.â€ Given Georgiaâ€™s political shift in the Trump era, heâ€™s probably onto something.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: Ossoff trails while Warnock leads. In the campaign, Warnock went out of his way to offer Ossoff his coattails, calling him â€œmy brother from another mother.â€

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: Time to begin the search for the Warnock-Perdue voters.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The Rev. Raphael Warnock has taken the lead over Senator Kelly Loeffler by about 32,000 votes. Jon Ossoff narrowly trails David Perdue.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Ossoff now with a 94 percent chance to win. The fundamental G.O.P. problem: Its vote is basically exhausted. Ossoff is favored to win the remaining vote by 36 points (he needs to win by 26 to prevail).

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Our estimates show Warnock with a greater than 95 percent chance to win. Loeffler has largely exhausted her vote, under reasonable assumptions.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Perdue is leading by 120,000 votes. But state election official Gabriel Sterling says DeKalb County has 171,000 votes to upload. Those will skew heavily to the Democrats.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: With many votes remaining uncounted in deep blue DeKalb County, I imagine that the Ossoff and Warnock campaigns are anxiously awaiting the results from there.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: With the margins razor-thin, Stacey Abrams has appeared in a new ad urging voters to check that their absentee ballot was counted. Voters have until Friday to fix problems.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Trump tweeted a false suggestion that Democrats were â€œwaiting to see how many votes they need.â€ His claim was particularly baffling since he pressed Georgia officials for just enough votes to overturn his loss.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The G.O.P. lead has grown, but itâ€™s made no dent in our estimate. In fact, Democratic chances have inched upward as the Republicansâ€™ chances to beat our expectations dwindle.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: No matter what happens tonight, Georgia has a changing electorate: new Black voters will play a decisive role, and the numbers of Latino and Asian-American voters have grown significantly.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: David Perdue has collected 15,000 more votes than his fellow Republican Kelly Loeffler, whose favorable ratings also lag Mr. Perdueâ€™s in voter surveys.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: If the Dems exceed Bidenâ€™s margins in blue counties, that seems to support Stacey Abramsâ€™s argument that the key is not persuading swing voters, itâ€™s getting left-leaning voters to the polls.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: Bearish G.O.P. strategist texts: â€œThis jump-starts the debate weâ€™ll see through the â€™24 election: Is Trump the problem or the solution?â€ Given suburban tallies, strategist says, itâ€™s plainly the former.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Republicans pleaded with Trump to care about this race. And as the runoff approached, they worried he had become more disengaged because he didnâ€™t want to help in a state heâ€™d lost.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Both Republicans ran on exaggerated fears of their opponents â€” â€œextremists,â€ â€œsocialistsâ€ â€” and banked on hugging Trump.Â But Trump left them out to dry, talking mostly of bogus claims of a â€œstolenâ€ election.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Fox News is reporting now on an issue that Republicans have been concerned about since November: The vote in rural Georgia tonight seems soft because the Trump base is depressed.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Raphael Warnock, a Baptist preacher born and raised in Georgia, would become his stateâ€™s first Black senator, breaking a barrier with distinct meaning in American politics.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: With the races close, worth mentioning that if the result is within 0.5 percentage points, the losing candidate can seek a recount. Ballots would be run through the scanners again.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: Chatham County, which includes Warnockâ€™s hometown, Savannah, and Cobb County, an increasingly diverse Atlanta suburb, still have large chunks of uncounted votes.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: DeKalb County, which has lagged other Atlanta-area counties in its reporting tonight, is the stateâ€™s fourth most populous county and tilts overwhelmingly Democratic.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Both Democrats remain heavily favored, despite their deficit in the tabulated vote. Theyâ€™re favored to win the vote left to be counted by 9 to 10 points.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: A lesson many Dems learned the hard way in the Obama years: Not so easy getting a presidentâ€™s voters to show up when heâ€™s not on the ballot. G.O.P. saw this in â€™18 and is anxious about the same tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling, a Georgia elections official, said that the largest tranche of remaining uncounted votes is from DeKalb County, a heavily Democratic suburban Atlanta area.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Question hanging over the night: If Perdue and Loeffler lose, how much sway will Trump hold with congressional Republicans tomorrow as he pushes them to object to certification of his loss?

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling, a Georgia elections official, says itâ€™s going to be a long night, with tranches of votes remaining from both large Democratic counties and small Republican ones.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Some 90 counties have completed counting. Most are small and show Loeffler well ahead, but in most, she is slightly underperforming the G.O.P. margins in the November Senate race.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: In Richmond County (Augusta) in November, the Democrats led by 36 percentage points. With almost all the votes counted, Warnock is leading by 43 points. Ossoffâ€™s lead is similar.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: In counties where most votes are counted and Warnock is leading, heâ€™s exceeding the Demsâ€™ margin in November by several points. In red counties Loeffler has about the same margin as the Republicans in November.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: More votes from Republican strongholds have come in, pushing the G.O.P. hopefuls into small leads for the moment. But a lot of Democrat-leaning ballots remain around Atlanta.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The race now leans toward the Democrats. Thereâ€™s a long way to go and itâ€™s close, but they have done better than they need across all vote methods and in all regions.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Despite a big push from G.O.P. officials to get their supporters to vote early, Republicans seem to have been more likely to vote on election day. Democrats dominated early voting.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Rockdale County is the largest thus far to report it has completed vote counting. The results there: Democrats are outperforming their November numbers by about 4 percentage points.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The northern Atlanta suburbs of the 6th Congressional District are a bellwether: home to Newt Gingrich, won by Trump in 2016 and Biden in 2020.Â Watch northern Fulton and DeKalb Counties and eastern Cobb County.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign spreading disinformation in a text to supporters: â€œIs it true that voting machines â€˜stopped workingâ€™ earlier in Georgia today? Are Dems trying to STEAL this Election?â€

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Trump may take much of the blame if the Republicans lose. Heâ€™s stoked doubts about Georgiaâ€™s elections in an effort to overturn his own loss â€” dividing Republicans in the process.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: Raphael Warnock talked explicitly about raceÂ and racism in his campaign, referring to the United Statesâ€™ legacy of slavery as â€œCovid-1619.â€

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Kelly Loeffler is only the second woman to serve as a senator from Georgia. The other, Rebecca Latimer Felton, served for one day in 1922.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: 40 percent of the estimated ballots have been counted. Democrats hold leads, but there are a lot of remaining votes, especially in Republican strongholds in northern Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: TargetSmart, a Democratic data firm, estimates Democrats improved on their share of early votes by 2.8 points compared to November. Election day turnout could erase that advantage.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Fair Fight Action, founded by Stacey Abrams, is urging voters to stay in line â€” a reminder of Georgiaâ€™s history of voter suppression, and a sign of the down-to-the-wire races.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Another sign of the importance of the race â€” and the money poured into it: 40 percent of voters surveyed by The A.P. said they were contacted on behalf of both partiesâ€™ candidates.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: In the first post-November election without Trump on the ballot, some analyses of early voting suggest Democrats maintained their enthusiasm, especially thanks to Black voters.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Polls of voters conducted by The A.P. reveal that David Perdue has slightly higher favorability ratings than his fellow Republican Kelly Loeffler â€” 50 percent to 47 percent.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: All that advertising seems to have worked for Republicans in at least one way: According to A.P. surveys, more voters see Ossoff and Warnock as â€œextremeâ€ than Perdue or Loeffler.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: Text from a progressive strategist involved in Democratic efforts in Georgia: â€œUgh. Here we go. That feeling I hate is back: hope.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Thereâ€™s big support among Georgia voters (74 percent) for requiring people to wear masks when around people outside the home, according to A.P. voter surveys.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Needle update: Democrats are faring a hair better than expected in the absentee vote, but the big question mark is the election day vote and we still have very little of it.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: The Trump-style, anti-press movement is alive and well in Georgia tonight: Georgia Public Broadcasting says the state G.O.P. barred a reporter from its election-night headquarters.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Thereâ€™s also a race for Public Service Commission, which sets utility rates. Lauren â€œBubbaâ€ McDonald, 82, an ardent Trump supporter, is facing a challenge by Daniel Blackman, 41.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: We are now at nearly 400,000 votes counted, and thus far the clearest takeaway is that both races are really too close to call.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: Nearly $300 million was spent on advertising in the Loeffler-Warnock race, making it the second most expensive Senate race ever â€” behind only Perdue-Ossoff.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: Roughly $404 million was spent on advertising in the Perdue-Ossoff race, according to Advertising Analytics, making it the most expensive Senate race ever.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: A.P. surveys get at the dissonance of the G.O.P. message: Most voters say Senate control is important, but if you believe Trumpâ€™s false claims that he won, the Senate isnâ€™t up for grabs.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Most Georgia voters said that deciding which party controls the Senate was the â€œsingle most important factorâ€ in casting their ballot, according to A.P. voter surveys.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: A.P. voter surveys show that Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger has weathered Trumpâ€™s savage attacks: 57 percent said they approved of the way he handled the 2020 results.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: Republicans say electing GA Dems would put the far left in charge. In reality, a 50-50 Senate would make people like Joe Manchin of WV, the most conservative Senate Dem, very powerful.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Officials were able to process and organize, but not count, early votes before 7 p.m. They hope that rule change will speed up counting of the 3.1 million early ballots cast.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Most polls are closed after what officials said was a mostly smooth day of voting in Georgia, but a handful of precincts will stay open past 7 p.m. because of earlier problems.

liveUpdates.author: Shaila Dewan
liveUpdates.text: I first interviewed Stacey Abrams around 2011, when she became minority leader of the Georgia Assembly. She told me then that Georgia could turn blue if Democrats would invest.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: 61 percent of voters surveyed in Georgia report that they believe Joe Biden was legitimately elected president, according to new A.P. survey results.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: New A.P. voter surveys in Georgia show that 32 percent of those voting identify as African-American or Black, a number that indicates high turnout in that demographic group.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: New A.P. voter surveys in Georgia: 59 percent of voters say they are â€œveryâ€ or â€œsomewhatâ€ confident that ineligible votes were not allowed during the presidential election.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Kelly Loeffler was appointed by Georgiaâ€™s governor to the Senate in 2019. Another appointed senator, Martha McSally of Arizona, lost in November when she had to face voters.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: You may be wondering why Georgia has these unusual runoff elections. The decades-old system has racist roots â€” part of an effort to dilute Black voting power.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Expect early returns to show a G.O.P. edge, with conservative counties likely to report results faster. Democratic counties, including suburban Atlanta, typically take more time.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Expect a G.O.P. advantage in the votes reported first. Republicans tend to cast more ballots on election day, which are reported faster than absentee and in-person early votes.
liveUpdates.image_credit: Lynsey Weatherspoon for The New York Times

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In this campaign, David Perdue has downplayed his extensive dealings in outsourcing manufacturing to China during his career in the apparel and textile industries.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: Senator Kelly Loeffler has strong Wall Street ties, starting with her husband, the chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, who directed $21 million to a pro-Loeffler PAC.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Baker
liveUpdates.text: Some trivia about the Rev. Raphael Warnock: He gave his first sermon when he was 11 years old. Hereâ€™s a closer look at the candidate and his background.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Jon Ossoff has worked in politics, but he has never held public office. Yet he is the best-funded Senate candidate in history, according to our recent profile of him.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: About 3.1 million people voted early, and that vote appeared to tilt Democratic. If another million people cast ballots today, Republicans believe they are likely to win.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Early voting returns worried some Republicans, who were not happy with the low turnout in conservative Northwest Georgia. They hope Trumpâ€™s rally there motivated supporters.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: At age 33, Jon Ossoff would be just three years over the minimum age for being a U.S. senator if he is elected in todayâ€™s runoff. His opponent, David Perdue, is 71.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: One thing to note: David Perdue is actually former Senator David Perdue. His term expired and the rest of the new Congress was sworn in on Sunday.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The Rev. Raphael Warnock, one of the Democratic candidates, is the senior pastor at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, where the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. once preached.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Kelly Loeffler, one of the Republicans in todayâ€™s runoff, was appointed by Gov. Brian Kemp to replace Johnny Isakson, who retired after his diagnosis with Parkinsonâ€™s disease.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: If Senator Kelly Loeffler wins today, she will have to run again in two years. She is filling out the unexpired term of Senator Johnny Isakson, who retired.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Another contest is underway â€” between reality and fantasy, as Trump seeks to sow doubts about Georgiaâ€™s election system. State officials are rebutting his charges in real time.
